text: Maximilian Wöber (born 4 February 1998) is an Austrian professional footballer. He plays as a centre-back for Austrian Bundesliga club Red Bull Salzburg and the Austria national team. ==Club career== ===Youth career=== He started his football career with Rapid Wien's youth teams. ===Rapid Wien=== 2015 till 2017 he played for Rapid Wien II. On 25 February 2016 he played his first match for SK Rapid Wien against Valencia in the UEFA Euro League. ===Ajax=== In August 2017 he went to Ajax for €7.5 million. ===Sevilla=== On 11 January 2019 he went on to Sevilla He signed a contract until 2023. ===Red Bull Salzburg=== On 13 August 2019 Wöber agreed to a five-year contract FC Red Bull Salzburg in the Austrian Bundesliga. It is said that Salzburg paid €12 million what makes him to the most expensive player in Austrian Bundesliga. ==International career== Wöber was in the Austria national football team for 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Wales and Georgia in September 2017. On 6 October 2017, he made his debut for the Austria national team in a 3–2 win against Serbia. ==Honours== Ajax *Eredivisie: 2019 *KNVB Cup: 2019 Red Bull Salzburg *Austrian Bundesliga: 2020, 2021, 2022 *Austrian Cup: 2020, 2021, 2022 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:Living people Category:1998 births Category:Association football defenders Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg players Category:SK Rapid Wien players Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:Austrian football champions Category:UEFA Euro 2024 players
title: Maximilian Wöber
